Re ''Out From the Ethical Deep Freeze'' (editorial, June 7): I live in a small town in the upper Hudson Valley, and we manage to have a working ethics committee. No one is paid a penny for serving. The committee meets about 10 times a year.

People (including whistleblowers) are encouraged to report apparent ethical violations. The committee investigates them in confidence, and if action is deemed in order, the matter is reported to the town government.
An annual report is submitted to the town government. And if our small town, with fewer than 4,000 citizens, can do it, what is wrong with our newly empowered House Democrats?
It can't be lack of money. It can't be a lack of paid staff. But if the rhetoric is remotely true, it can't be a lack of will. Is it a lack of ethics?
Theodore S. Voelker Copake, N.Y., June 7, 2007
